title: FYP Project
text:
This page highlights two major project experiences that shaped my interest in applied computing and data-driven systems. The first was my Final Year Project (FYP) at Temasek Polytechnic (TP) in Aviation Management, conducted in collaboration with Changi Airport Group (CAG). The second was my technical work during National Service (NS) under the Digital Intelligence Service, where I was exposed to applied artificial intelligence and data analytics in an operational environment.
Together, these experiences motivated my transition into Applied Computing (FinTech) at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT).

title: FYP Project
text:
This page highlights two major project experiences that shaped my interest in applied computing and data-driven systems. The first was my Final Year Project (FYP) at Temasek Polytechnic (TP) in Aviation Management, conducted in collaboration with Changi Airport Group (CAG). The second was my technical work during National Service (NS) under the Digital Intelligence Service, where I was exposed to applied artificial intelligence and data analytics in an operational environment.
Together, these experiences motivated my transition into Applied Computing (FinTech) at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT).

title: FYP Project
section: ‚úàÔ∏è Final Year Project (TP): AR Wayfinding at Changi Airport
text:
‚úàÔ∏è Final Year Project (TP): AR Wayfinding at Changi Airport
During my diploma studies in Aviation Management at Temasek Polytechnic, I worked on a Final Year Project in collaboration with Changi Airport Group (CAG). The project explored the feasibility of implementing Augmented Reality (AR) wayfinding solutions to enhance passenger navigation within airport terminals.
Large international airports such as Changi Airport serve millions of passengers annually, and first-time or transit passengers often experience difficulty navigating terminals efficiently. Traditional static signage may not always provide intuitive or personalised guidance, especially in complex layouts. The project aimed to evaluate whether AR-based navigation could improve wayfinding efficiency and overall passenger experience.


Technical Approach & Software Used
Although the project originated from a non-computing discipline, it involved several technical and analytical components.
Key technologies and software used included:

Python

Used for basic scripting and logic development
Simulated routing logic, distance calculations, and directional guidance
Assisted in processing structured data related to navigation paths

AR Development & Prototyping Tools

Mobile AR frameworks for concept prototyping
3D spatial mapping concepts to represent indoor environments
User interaction design for visual overlays and directional cues

Data & Productivity Tools

Microsoft Excel for data collection, comparison of navigation paths, and analysis
Presentation and prototyping tools to communicate design concepts to stakeholders


The emphasis of the project was not on building a full production system, but on assessing concept feasibility, user experience, and operational value in a real-world airport setting.



Outcomes & Learning
This project provided early exposure to: - translating real-world operational challenges into technical concepts, - applying data and logic to support navigation systems, - collaborating with an industry partner (CAG), - and communicating technical ideas clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
The experience sparked my interest in technology-driven solutions and laid the foundation for my subsequent pursuit of applied computing.

title: FYP Project
text:
ü™ñ National Service: Digital Intelligence Service
During my National Service, I served under the Digital Intelligence Service, where I worked on technology-focused initiatives supporting intelligence and analytical capabilities. The role provided hands-on exposure to applied artificial intelligence, data processing, and analytical systems in a secure operational environment.


AI, Semantic Search & Analytics Exposure
Throughout my service, I supported projects involving machine learning and data-driven analysis, including:

AI Model Training & Evaluation

Assisted in data preparation, preprocessing, and labelling
Supported training and testing of AI models
Evaluated model outputs and performance metrics

Target Recognition Capabilities

Worked with systems designed for object and target recognition
Gained understanding of how data quality, model accuracy, and false positives impact operational effectiveness
Supported validation and testing workflows

Semantic Search & Sentiment Analysis

Contributed to semantic search capabilities for analysing large volumes of unstructured text data
Supported sentiment analysis to assess public opinion and trends across global sources
Helped analyse how sentiment patterns could be identified and monitored using AI-driven search and retrieval techniques


Technologies and tools involved included: - Python for scripting and data handling - Machine learning frameworks for model training workflows - Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts such as embeddings and semantic similarity - Secure analytical platforms for data exploration and evaluation
While the work was conducted within controlled environments, the experience provided valuable insight into real-world AI deployment and analytics.

title: FYP Project
text:
üîó Reflection & Impact
These combined experiences ‚Äî spanning aviation, AR systems, AI model training, semantic search, and sentiment analysis ‚Äî strongly influenced my decision to pursue Applied Computing (FinTech) at SIT.
They reinforced my interest in: - applied data analytics, - AI-enabled systems, - and the practical use of computing to support decision-making in complex environments.
At SIT, I aim to further strengthen my technical foundations and continue applying computing and data to real-world problem domains.

title: Data Visualization
text: This visualization was created to analyse how the 3-month Singapore Overnight Rate Average (SORA) changed over time. The purpose of this task was to better understand interest rate movements and their potential impact on financial decisions such as borrowing and saving.

title: Data Visualization
text: This visualization was created to analyse how the 3-month Singapore Overnight Rate Average (SORA) changed over time. The purpose of this task was to better understand interest rate movements and their potential impact on financial decisions such as borrowing and saving.

title: Data Visualization
text:
üìà What is visualized
This visualization presents quantitative time-series data showing the 3-month Singapore Overnight Rate Average (SORA) from 2020 to 2025.

The x-axis represents time (month and year)
The y-axis represents interest rates (percentage)
Each data point corresponds to a numerical interest rate value for a given month

In addition to SORA, the chart includes reference interest rates from major local banks (DBS, OCBC, and UOB) to provide contextual comparison.
The data visualized consists entirely of numerical values, clearly satisfying the requirement for quantitative data visualization.

title: Data Visualization
text:
üß† Rationale for the visualization
A line chart was chosen because it is the most appropriate visualization method for time-series financial data. Line charts make it easy to observe trends, turning points, and fluctuations over time.
Using multiple lines allows direct comparison between SORA and bank reference rates, making differences and similarities in interest rate movements immediately visible. This approach communicates patterns more effectively than viewing raw numerical data in a table.

title: Data Visualization
text:
üìñ Story behind the visualization
This visualization was created during my student life as part of a project in the Foundations of FinTech module. The goal of the project was to analyse how interest rates change over time and to understand their implications for financial products, borrowing costs, and savings decisions.
The chart shows a prolonged period of low interest rates, followed by a sharp increase during monetary tightening, and a subsequent gradual decline. Visualising the data made it easier to interpret interest rate cycles and relate theoretical concepts from the module to real-world financial conditions.
Overall, this visualization demonstrates how quantitative financial data can be transformed into meaningful insights through appropriate graphical representation.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text: This page reflects on my experience using Generative AI (GenAI) tools to support the completion of this assessment, particularly in building and documenting my Quarto website.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text: This page reflects on my experience using Generative AI (GenAI) tools to support the completion of this assessment, particularly in building and documenting my Quarto website.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: GenAI tool used and reason for choice
text:
GenAI tool used and reason for choice
The primary GenAI tool I used for this assessment was ChatGPT. I chose this tool because of its ability to provide clear explanations, examples, and guidance for both technical and writing-related tasks. As someone still learning how to use Quarto and structure a website, ChatGPT was helpful in breaking down unfamiliar concepts into manageable steps.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: How GenAI helped in completing the assessment
text:
How GenAI helped in completing the assessment
GenAI supported my work in several practical ways throughout the assessment:

It helped me understand how to structure a Quarto website, including how to organise pages such as the homepage, data visualization page, and reflection page.
It provided examples of Quarto (.qmd) formatting, such as YAML headers, headings, and how to embed images correctly.
It assisted in drafting clear explanations for my data visualization, especially in explaining what was visualized, the rationale for the chart choice, and the story behind the visualization.
It helped refine my writing by improving clarity, flow, and structure while keeping the content aligned with the assessment requirements.

These examples allowed me to work more efficiently and focus on understanding the concepts rather than struggling with syntax or formatting issues.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Benefits of using GenAI
One of the main benefits of using GenAI was time efficiency. It allowed me to quickly obtain guidance and examples when I encountered difficulties, reducing trial-and-error. Additionally, GenAI helped improve the clarity of my explanations, which is especially useful for written assessments that require reflection and justification.
Another benefit was that it supported learning by explaining why certain approaches were appropriate, such as why a particular type of chart is suitable for time-series data.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Challenges and limitations of GenAI
Despite its benefits, there are also challenges in using GenAI. The outputs provided are not always perfect and require verification. I still needed to test code, check formatting, and ensure that the content accurately reflected my own work.
There is also a risk of over-reliance on GenAI. Without careful use, it can be tempting to accept suggestions without fully understanding them. To address this, I made an effort to review and adjust the outputs so that I remained actively involved in the learning process.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: Future use of GenAI in study or work
text:
Future use of GenAI in study or work
In the future, I believe GenAI tools will be useful for assisting with learning new technologies, debugging code, and drafting documentation or reports. In both academic and professional settings, GenAI can act as a support tool to improve productivity and understanding, especially when working with unfamiliar tools or concepts.
However, I also recognise the importance of using GenAI responsibly, ensuring that it complements rather than replaces critical thinking and independent problem-solving.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Additional reflections
Overall, using GenAI for this assessment was a positive learning experience. It helped me complete the task more effectively while also improving my understanding of Quarto, data visualization, and reflective writing. When used thoughtfully, GenAI can be a valuable learning aid.

text:
üßë‚Äçüíº About Me



Outside of my academic work, I enjoy staying active and exploring new experiences.
Some of my hobbies include running and golfing, which help me stay disciplined and focused. More recently, I picked up surfing during a trip to Bali, which sparked a deeper interest in outdoor and adventure-based activities.
I enjoy travelling and experiencing different cultures, especially trips that involve adventure, nature, and hands-on experiences. These interests reflect my curiosity and willingness to step outside my comfort zone‚Äîboth personally and academically.
